message.content:
cs.IR, cs.DL, cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.CY 

The paper discusses the structure and dynamics of science and proposes retrieval services for metadata-driven digital libraries. The paper focuses on information retrieval and the proposed services are evaluated with relevance assessments. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The paper also discusses digital libraries, which falls under cs.DL (Digital Libraries). The proposed services involve co-word analysis, which is a common technique in natural language processing and falls under cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses author centrality, which is related to social network analysis and falls under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the paper proposes a new framework for scholarly information systems, which falls under cs.CY (Computers and Society).
